critique: The document establishes the National Infrastructure Assurance Council (NIAC) to coordinate public and private sector efforts to protect critical infrastructure. It aims to enhance partnerships, encourage risk assessments, and monitor information sharing. The NIAC is composed of members from the private sector and state/local government, appointed by the President. The council advises lead agencies and reports to the President through the Assistant to the President for National Security Affairs. The order emphasizes cooperation between government and private entities to address threats to national infrastructure. It does not obviously lean strongly on any of the axes. It has a slight tilt toward national security, but it is mostly balanced.
